label: HTML
title: HTML Topics
description: HyperText Markup Language. Standard language used to create and design the structure of web pages on the internet. HTML uses a system of tags to define elements such as headings, paragraphs, links, images, and other content that browsers display.

label: CSS
title: CSS Topics
description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS). A language used to describe how HTML elements should look on a web page. It controls the style of a website. Specificity in CSS determines which rule wins when multiple rules target the same element. Each type of selector has a point value.

label: JavaScript
title: JavaScript Topics
description: JavaScript is a high-level scripting language that runs in web browsers to add interactivity, control multimedia, handle events, and update content without reloading the page.

label: Backend
title: Backend Topics
description: The whole server application which handles everything behind the scenes of your website or web application.
